contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=December 2009}} {{Green politics sidebar |expanded=all}} The '''Green Party''' (Sakartvelo's mtsvaneta partia) is a political party in [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]. It is led by [[Gia Gacheviladze|Gia (George) Gachechiladze]]. Its success has varied - having 11 out of 235 members of parliament in 1992 and having been part of the governing coalition in 1995. When it stood independently in 1999 it only received 0.55% of the vote. It stood as part of [[Eduard Shevardnadze]]'s coalition in the annulled 2003 [[Georgian legislative election, 2003|elections]]. It believes that the [[Georgian legislative election, 2003|2003 elections]] were "the most transparent process in the history of Georgia". {{Citation needed|date=September 2008}} ==See also== {{Portal box|Sustainable development|Environment|Ecology}} *[[Green party]] *[[Green politics]] *[[List of environmental organizations]] ==External links== {{commonscat|Green Party of Georgia}} * {{ka icon}} [http://www.greensparty.ge/ Official homepage] {{Green parties}} [[Category:Green political parties]] [[Category:Political parties in Georgia (country)]] [[Category:Global Greens member parties]] {{Georgia-party-stub}}
